newsitem.title: ZIMBABWE: ZIMBABWE DOLLAR ENDS WEDNESDAY FIRMER ON UNITS.
newsitem.headline: ZIMBABWE DOLLAR ENDS WEDNESDAY FIRMER ON UNITS.

text.p: The Zimbabwe dollar closed on Wednesday firmer against the U.S. unit and other hard currencies after a fairly active interbank trading session, foreign exchange dealers said.

"We saw quite a number of inflows today and it was mostly a sellers market to start with," one dealer commented, adding however that the dollar later depreciated on the back of last-minute import pressure coupled with intervention by the central bank to mop up excess foreign currency from the market.

Dealers say the Reserve Bank has kept a tight leash on the local unit despite a steady inflow of mostly tobacco export receipts, to make sure it does not appreciate beyond levels compatible with annual inflation, currently at 22.4 percent.
At Wednesday's close, the local unit was quoted at 11.2960/3060 against the U.S. dollar from 11.3000/3100 the previous day and at 18.4015/4230 on sterling compared to 18.5000/5200.
Against the mark it also gained to 6.53005/5325 from 6.5500/5700 and was at 2.5270/5280 versus the rand from 2.5300/5500.
